sen.j: 殿内 義雄（とのうち よしお、天保元年（1830年）～文久3年3月25日 (旧暦)（1863年4月29日））は、江戸時代・幕末の人物。
sen.e: Yoshio TONOUCHI (1830-April 29, 1863) was a person in the end of Edo period.
Yoshio TONOUCHI (1830-April 29, 1863) lived during the end of the Edo Period.
Yoshio TONOUCHI (1830 - May 12, 1863) lived during the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。period小文字にしました。

sen.j: 浪士組の一人。
sen.e: He was a member of roshi-gumi (an organization of masterless samurai).
He was a member of roshi-gumi (an organization of masterless samurai).
He was a member of roshi-gumi (an organization of masterless samurai).

sen.j: 結城藩士の子、あるいは殿内村（現在の千葉県山武郡）の豪農・土屋忠右衛門の子として生まれた。
sen.e: He was born the child of statesman of the Yuki clan, or the child of Chuemon TSUCHIYA, the wealth farmer of Tonouchi village (present-day Sanbu-gun, Chiba Prefecture).
He was born the child of a statesman of the Yuki clan, Chuemon TSUCHIYA, a wealthly farmer of Tonouchi village (present-day Sanbu-gun, Chiba Prefecture).
He was born the child of a statesman of the Yuki clan, Chuemon TSUCHIYA, a wealthy farmer of Tonouchi village (present-day Sanbu-gun, Chiba Prefecture).

sen.j: 江戸（現在の東京）の昌平坂学問所（現在の東京大学に相当。）で学問を究めた。
sen.e: He dedicated himself to study at Shoheizaka Gakumonjo (Shoheizaka School) (corresponds to present day Tokyo University) in Edo (present-day Tokyo).
sen.cmt: セルＢ８、９を結合し訳出しました。

sen.j: また、屈強剛権な体格で、剣術の腕にも優れていたという。
sen.e: It is believed that he was sturdy and strong, and was excellent in martial arts.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）、清河八郎発案の浪士組に参加し、役職（目付役）を与えられるが何らかの落ち度で降格。
sen.e: In 1863, he joined roshi-gumi founded by Hachiro KIYOKAWA, and he was granted the title of superintendent officer, but he was demoted for his failures.

sen.j: 京（現在の京都市）に上りいざこれからという時に、清河は浪士組を率いて江戸へと帰って攘夷を行おうとした。
sen.e: When they reached to Kyo (present-day Kyoto) to attain something they had planned, KIYOKAWA was about to go back to Edo for expulsion of foreigners with roshi-gumi.
sen.cmt: いざこれからという時に→文意があいまいで不明だったのですが→to attain something they had planned, と訳出しています。
sen.e: When they reached Kyo (present-day Kyoto) to hatch a plan, KIYOKAWA tried to returnto Edo to expell foreigners from Japan together with roshi-gumi.
When they reached Kyo (present-day Kyoto) to hatch a plan, Kiyokawa tried to return to Edo to expell foreigners from Japan together with roshi-gumi.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。余分なスペース削除しました。Kiyokawa小文字にしました。

sen.j: それに賛同し、多くの者が清河に付き従った。
sen.e: Many members agreed with KIYOKAWA, and accompanied him.
Many members agreed with KIYOKAWA, and accompanied him.
Many members agreed with Kiyokawa, and accompanied him.

sen.j: また、その動きとは別に、鵜殿鳩翁から、家里次郎と共に浪士組内の壬生村での残留者の取りまとめの責任者の役目を任される。
sen.e: Apart from KIYOKAWA's movement, he was assigned by Kyuo UDONO to the responsible person for organizing the remained members of rioshi-gumi in Mibu village together with Tsuguo IESATO.
Apart from KIYOKAWA's movement, he was assigned by Kyuo UDONO to person responsible for organizing the remaining members of roshi-gumi in Mibu village together with Tsuguo IESATO.

sen.j: （殿内と家里は、募集する側の責任者だったので、名簿に記載されていない。）

sen.j: 芹沢鴨・新見錦（田中伊織）・平山五郎･粕谷新五郎・平間重助・野口健司ら水戸藩出身者、阿比類、近藤勇・山南敬助・土方歳三・永倉新八・原田左之助・沖田総司・井上源三郎ら試衛館道場の者、斎藤一・佐伯又三郎ら京で参加したもの、根岸友山・清水吾一ら根岸派が結集する。
sen.e: The members from the Mito clan; Kamo SERIZAWA, Nishiki NIIMI (Iori TANAKA), Jusuke HIRAMA, Goro HIRAYAMA, Shingoro KASUYA, Jusuke HIRAMA, Kenji NOGUCHI, the members from Shieikan training hall; ABIRU, Isami KONDO, Keisuke YAMANAMI, Toshizo HIJIKATA, Shinpachi NAGAKURA, Sanosuke HARADA, Soji OKITA, the members who joined in Kyoto including Genzaburo INOUE, Hajime SAITO and Matasaburo SAEKI, and NEGISHI force including Yuzan NEGISHI and Goichi SHIMIZU came together.
sen.cmt: ）のみセルＢ16にペーストしました。根岸派→NEGISHI force と訳出しています（定訳不明のため）。

sen.j: 最初の壬生浪士の筆頭格であったが、近藤勇に激しく憎まれた（近藤が何らかの憎悪を抱き、殿内を討ち果たした、という書簡が残されている。）せいか殿内自身の資料・伝承に乏しい。
sen.e: He was the top warrior of Mibu-Roshi (Mibu masterless warriors group), but references and traditions regarding him are only few perhaps because he was hated violently by Isami KONDO (The document which described that KONDO killed TONOUCHI for his hatred is left).
sen.cmt: セルＢ19を18にペーストしました。
sen.e: He was the top warrior of Mibu-Roshi (Mibu masterless warriors group), but there are few references and traditions concerning him, most likely due to the fact that he was violently hated by Isami KONDO (There still remains a document which says that KONDO killed TONOUCHI out of this hatred).

He was the top warrior of Mibu-Roshi (Mibu masterless warriors group), but there are few references and traditions concerning him, most likely due to the fact that he was violently hated by Isami KONDO (There still remains a document which says that Kondo killed Tonouchi out of this hatred).
sen.cmt: Kondo, Tonouchi小文字にしました。

sen.j: 近藤、芹沢、根岸らは、既にそれぞれ派閥を形成していたが、殿内と家里は、江戸幕府の信用で筆頭格になったので、派閥らしいものはなく（のちの粛清の嵐など想像もつかなかったことだろう。）、旧知の根岸らと近かったとされている。
sen.e: It is said that KONDO, SERIZAWA, NEGISHI had already organized their respective factions, but TONOUCHI and IESATO didn't have any factions (probably, they never imagined the many warriors would be purged in future) as they became the top warriors with the confidence of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and they were close to NEGISHI.
sen.cmt: セルＢ21を20にペーストしました。
sen.e: It is said that KONDO, SERIZAWA, NEGISHI had already organized their respective factions, but TONOUCHI and IESATO didn't have any factions (probably, they never imagined that so many warriors would be purged in the future) as they became the top warriors who had the confidence of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and were close to NEGISHI.

It is said that Kondo, Serizawa, Negishi had already organized their respective factions, but Tonouchi and Iesato didn't have any factions (probably, they never imagined that so many warriors would be purged in the future) as they became the top warriors who had the confidence of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and were close to Negishi.
sen.cmt: Kondo, Serizawa, Negishi, Tonouchi, Iesato小文字にしました。

sen.j: 殿内は、自前の派閥を形成するために旅に出ようとする際、近藤らにしこたま酒を飲まされた。
sen.e: Just before TONOUCHI leaved Kyoto to organize his own faction, KONDO offered him a lot of Sake.

Just before Tonouchi left Kyoto to organize his own faction, Kondo offered him a sizeable amount of Sake.

sen.j: その後、京都四条大橋にて闇討ちに遭い命を落とした（近藤勇と沖田総司に襲われ、沖田に殺害されたという。）。
sen.e: After that, he had a sneak attack, and died on Shijio-ohashi Bridge in Kyoto (It is believed that he was attacked by Isami KONDO and Soji OKITA, and was killed by OKITA).

sen.e: After that, he was attacked by surprise, and died on Shijio-ohashi Bridge in Kyoto (It is believed that he was attacked by Isami KONDO and Soji OKITA, and was killed by OKITA).
After that, he was attacked by surprise, and died on Shijio-ohashi Bridge in Kyoto (It is believed that he was attacked by Isami KONDO and Soji OKITA, and was killed by Okita).

sen.j: 殿内は、旅支度の姿で刀は袋にしまった状態であったという。
sen.e: TONOUCHI was killed with the clothes and belongings for a travel; his sword was kept in a bag.
TONOUCHI was killed while wearing clothes and having belongings fit for travel; his sword was kept in a bag.
Tonouchi was killed while wearing clothes and having belongings fit for travel; his sword was kept in a bag.

sen.j: 近藤との確執の原因は、諸説あり、殿内自身の人間性に問題があったとするものや、近藤の野心の犠牲者になった第一号、芹沢派による粛清など様々。
sen.e: Various reasons are considered for the feud between TONOUCHI and KONDO including: TONOUCHI didn't have a fine character; he was the first person who was killed for KONDO's ambition; it was the purge by SERIZAWA faction.

Various reasons abound as to the reason behind the feud between TONOUCHI and KONDO including: TONOUCHI's less than fine character; he was the first person who was killed as a result of KONDO's ambition; it was a purge carried out by the SERIZAWA faction.

Various reasons abound as to the reason behind the feud between Tonouchi and Kondo including: Tonouchi's less than fine character; he was the first person who was killed as a result of Kondo's ambition; it was a purge carried out by the Serizawa faction.

sen.j: 殿内が殺害されずに健在ならば、新選組もまた幕末史において違った存在になったであろう。
sen.e: If TONOUCHI had not been killed and had been available, Shinsengumi would have been a different group in the end of Edo.
If TONOUCHI had not been killed and had been available, Shinsengumi would have been a different group during the end of the Edo period.
If Tonouchi had not been killed and had been available, Shinsengumi would have been a different group during the end of the Edo period.
